N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 108.2 - Material and size

State Regulations

The flag for use in school assembly rooms should be of
silk; and of such proportion and size as to command attention and
respect. (a) For one-teacher school
classroom or other small room, used for assembly purposes, the following sizes
are recommended: (1)
3 feet by 5 feet on
8-foot standard; or
(2)
2 feet, 6
inches by 4 feet on 7- or 7 1/2-foot standard. (b) For auditorium or large assembly hall, the following sizes are suggested: (1)
5 feet
by 9 feet on 12-foot standard; (2)
4 feet, 4 inches by 5 feet, 6 inches on 9-foot standard (see Army regulations
260-10, paragraph 4); or
(3)
4 feet
by 6 feet on 9-foot standard. (c) (1)

The
flag proportions shall be as follows: Hoist (width) of flag............1.0

Fly (length) of flag............1.9

Hoist (width) of union............7/13

Fly (length) of union............0.76

Width of each stripe............1/13
(2)

For schools that wish to provide flags of
such proportion as the foregoing, the following sizes are recommended: (i) For classroom or other small room used
for assembly purposes, 2.37 feet by 4.5 feet on 7- or 71/2-foot
standard. (ii)

For auditorium or
large assembly hall, 4 feet by 7.6 feet on 12-foot standard, or 5 feet by 9.5
feet on 14- or 15-foot standard. Notes
